itemDescription: First president of Ford Motor Company

wikipedia_page.main: John Simpson Gray (October 5, 1841 – July 6, 1906) was a candymaker, business man, and banker from Detroit.  He was also an original investor in (and the first president of) the Ford Motor Company.

response: On November 9, 1960, McNamara became the first president of Ford Motor Company from outside the Ford family, since John S. Gray in 1906.
*John S. Gray (Idaho politician) (1851–1902), American politician, Lieutenant Governor of Idaho
*John S. Gray (businessman) (1841–1906), Scottish-born American candymaker, businessman, and first president of Ford Motor Company
